TITLE.P: Framework Agreement for Provision of Care at Home Services in Perth and Kinross.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Framework Agreement for the provision of care at home for adults who are resident in Perth and Kinross and eligible for community care services for services commissioned by the Council under Option 3, Self-directed Support. Service providers will be directly commissioned by the Council.

The Council, along with service users and Providers, wishes to operate an outcome based approach to the purchase and provision of care at home services. Outcome-focused services aim to achieve the goals, aspirations or priorities of the individuals and offer a more flexible way of delivering care to support people to live independently at home for longer.

LOT_COMBINING_CONTRACT_RIGHT.P: Where zero bids or zero acceptable bids are received for any individual Lot the contracting authority reserves the right to combine the Lot with another Lot. Lots would be combined based on ‘nearest neighbour’ principle.

TITLE.P: Provision of Care at Home Services — North Perthshire 2 (Blairgowrie)

SHORT_DESCR.P: The core purpose of care at home is to support people, and where appropriate their carers, to remain in their own homes, living as independently as possible with a good quality of life.
We aim to ensure that care at home:
— supports people to live well in the community,
— prevents people with significant health or care needs from having to use emergency services or be admitted to hospital inappropriately,
— helps people with care needs to look after themselves in the community,
The range of services to be provided includes personal care and support designed to:
— help individuals sustain, recover or manage their health and abilities;
— lead independent and fulfilling lives; or approach the end of life in their own homes where this is their choice.

INFO_ADD.P: The Service shall be provided in accordance with the Conditions of Contract at the following agreed fixed rates:
— Urban Areas: 15.49 GBP per hour.
— Rural Areas: 17.00 GBP per hour.
— Remote Rural Areas: Additional payment based on a proportion of rural rate of 17.00 GBP. To be applied pro-rata based on assessed individual business cases.

RULES_CRITERIA.P: — Must meet the required registration standards for a care support service with the Care Inspectorate in Scotland.
— Expected to have a current ratio of min 1 for last 3 yrs. Reasons for not meeting req value to be disclosed.
— Must hold, or commit to obtain prior to the commence of any subsequently awarded contract, the types and levels of insurance indicated below:
— Bidders will be required to confirm that they have the following:
Be registered with the Care Inspectorate as fit to manage a care service
— Managerial staff must have the following qualifications:
Reg Managers minimum of SVQ L4 or equiv in Management and Health and Social Care
Supervisors minimum of SVQ L3 or equiv in Health and Social Care and 2 units of SVQ L4 or equiv in Management by 30/06/2017

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: Please see tender documents, with particular reference to qualifications, fair work practices and electronic payment system implementation.

FRAMEWORK.JUSTIFICATION: Supports vulnerable elderly people to live independently at home in line with strategic priorities for the Council. Stability of service & continuity of care vital for service users.Certainty for providers in a context in which we are expecting partnership working & flexibility to make changes. Short contracts may deter investment to improve in fragile market that is high risk to the Council.

MAIN_FEATURES_AWARD.P: Proposals will be evaluated with a Quality weighting of 100 %. Written method statements will be weighted at 70 % with the highest scoring Tenderers being invited for interview, weighted at 30 %. Services shall be carried out at a fixed hourly rate of 15.49 for Urban Areas and 17.00 for Rural Areas. For Remote Rural Areas an additional payment will be made based on a proportion of the rural rate of 17.00 GBP.
Refer to Instructions for Tenderers for full details.
